content.webTitle: Exiled motorist freed after public protest

fields.headline: Exiled motorist freed after public protest
fields.bodyText: A Siberian court yesterday freed a motorist who had been sentenced to four years of internal exile after being caught in a car crash that killed a high-profile governor, providing a victory for the protest movement that rallied around his case. Oleg Shcherbinsky was convicted for causing death by negligent driving after his car hit that of Mikhail Yevdokimov, a former comedian turned governor of the Altai region, causing it to pile into a roadside tree. Mr Shcherbinsky's defence team claimed the governor's car was travelling at 125mph when it hit their client's car.
